1328.56.text:
clambering to squeeze into the social space

1337.28.text: An alternative type of inclusion is accommodation.

1340.08.text:
Here, disenfranchised groups
remain true to themselves

1343.16.text:
copying no one and defining their own

1356.46.text:
Unfortunately, some members of disenfranchised
groups only believe themselves worthy of type one

1361.58.text:
trying to make themselves

1365.28.text:
Even more unfortunately, some of those individuals
expect their fellow members to do the same.

1370.40.text:
Those who dare simply to be themselves
are sometimes marginalised

1374.06.text: with the accusation: 'You make the rest of us look bad!'

1377.38.text: For me, there are few things sadder

1379.52.text: than when oppressed groups oppress their own members to gain mainstream approval.

1384.00.text:
The point isn't to try and
make yourself more acceptable.

1387.20.text: The point is to recognise you're already acceptable

1389.90.text: and to end the oppressive idea that you're not.

1393.46.text:
It can be a long exhausting journey
for a disenfranchised group

1396.70.text: fighting for rights and social recognition.

1399.02.text:
But in that struggle, we need to
take care not to push other groups back.

1403.20.text: Sometimes groups are erroneously lumped together.

1406.20.text: Cross-dressers might be confused with transsexuals.

1409.10.text: Homosexuals might all be cast as polyamorous.

1411.82.text: It's important to separate distinct traits like these.

1414.98.text: But in distancing ourselves from other groups

1417.52.text:
it's also important not to downgrade those
other groups with negative comments.

1421.83.text:
The more we value everyone's diversity,
the more we ensure our own will be valued.

1428.26.text:
The other day, a relative of mine, who I once considered
one of the most stubbornly bigoted individuals I knew

1433.82.text:
brought up the time I came out
to her in my teenage years.

1437.14.text:
Choking back tears, she recalled the huge
hostilities between us

1445.28.text: Behind her sadness, I sensed her utter mystification.

1449.26.text:
She could simply no longer relate
to the person she was back then.

1452.96.text: Sometimes, folks can evolve beyond imagination.

1471.39.text:
Coming out can be a risky process but
the gains can be huge as you reclaim your life.

1477.16.text:
Before the exchange, it's worth assessing

1481.70.text: reflecting on how your aims affect your power position;

1490.52.text:
It's worth holding in mind that you're imparting

1493.98.text:
that through no fault of yours

1497.90.text:
Protecting yourself from persecution by deception

1503.24.text:
Beware of making — or submitting to —

1510.02.text:
And if any rifts do sprang up between

1516.12.text:
After the exchange, stay strong — especially in the

1521.90.text:
Remember: inclusion isn't about shrinking yourself

1527.78.text:
When distancing ourselves from other groups,

1533.12.text: And if things do seem to get off to a bad start

1536.80.text: Things can sometimes evolve beyond recognition.
